p: Partners from the biodiversity community also have a strong role for participation, through conservation efforts that are increasingly recognizing the risks of infectious disease agents to wildlife populations (e.g., great ape die-offs from infection with Ebola). The UN’s Convention on Biological Diversity recently “recognized the value of a One Health approach” toward shared health and biodiversity benefits at its 12th Conference of the Parties in October 2014, and also has addressed sustainable use of biodiversity in terms of bushmeat and sustainable wildlife management, providing a possible entry for work on both topics by CBD member countries.
